Odds Calculation Formulas

Probability from American odds:

Positive Odds: Probability = 100 ÷ (Odds + 100)

Negative Odds: Probability = |Odds| ÷ (|Odds| + 100)

Payout calculation:

Payout = Bet Amount × (Odds + 1)

Profit = Payout - Bet Amount

Frequently Asked Questions

What's the difference between American, Decimal, and Fractional odds?

American odds use +/- (e.g., +150, -200), Decimal odds show total payout (e.g., 2.50), and Fractional odds use fractions (e.g., 3/2). All represent the same probability but in different formats.

How do I calculate implied probability from odds?

For American odds: Positive odds probability = 100 ÷ (odds + 100), Negative odds probability = |odds| ÷ (|odds| + 100). This shows the bookmaker's implied probability of the outcome.

What is value betting and how do I find it?

Value betting occurs when your calculated probability is higher than the implied probability from the odds. If you think an outcome has a 60% chance but the odds imply 50%, that's value.

How do I convert between different odds formats?

American to Decimal: Positive odds = (odds ÷ 100) + 1, Negative odds = (100 ÷ |odds|) + 1. Decimal to Fractional: Subtract 1 and convert to fraction. Our calculator handles all conversions automatically.

What's the difference between probability and odds?

Probability is the likelihood of an event (0-1 or 0-100%), while odds are the ratio of favorable to unfavorable outcomes. Odds can be converted to probability and vice versa.

Responsible Betting Tips

  • Only bet what you can afford to lose
  • Understand the odds and probabilities before betting
  • Set a budget and stick to it
  • Don't chase losses with bigger bets
  • Research teams, players, and conditions before betting
  • Use odds calculators to make informed decisions
  • Remember that gambling should be entertainment, not investment
  • Seek help if gambling becomes a problem
